parameters.content:
## Trigger Options / Config
- run workflow manually
- run workflow on a schedule

## Load Data Source
- Load RSS feeds defined in Code node
- extract title and content

parameters.content:
## POST To Wordpress

- Load articles from Google Sheetset to publish=true and Publish Date set to Today's date
- Load articles from Google Sheet set to publish=true and Publish Date set to blank

These options allow Blog Articles to be cued up days or weeks in advance, OR auto-post today if no date set

nodes.name: Check for Article of existing Title

json.output:
{
  "title": "Quis Quis Nostrud: The Latin Guide to Avoiding Boring, Except on Tuesdays",
  "content": "Welcome to the snazzy world of Quis Quis Nostrud! This isn't your run-of-the-mill space odyssey—no ma'am, this is the epic saga of those who dare to nostrud. Picture this: diligently resisting the urge to duis that mundane laborum because, really, who needs ex qui consectetur when you've got a grand temporal adventure at hand? 

Let's break it down. Nostrud is not just the squiggly lines you see before your coffee kicks in; it is the art of participating in something—anything really—without having the memory stick of life's melodrama full. High fives to all nostrud aficionados who manage to simulate conventional enthusiasm while secretly plotting their next daring escape from... well, everyone.

As you're likely contemplating the ridiculous profundity of Latin phrases, be reminded: tempor sint just adds a semicolon to time-out situations. Of course, you might prefer to marathon your own personal soap opera, but hey, chacun à son goût.  

Remember, with great nostrud comes great laborum—because let's face it, every hero needs a villain. You've got this, champ! Keep the illusion going, and who knows, you might just find yourself tempor sunt-ing like a true champion!"
}

```json
{
  "title": "The Bizarre Art of Mastering the Useless",
  "content": "Welcome, fellow wanderer of the digital abyss, to the realm where 'quis quis nostrud duis laborum' isn't just Latin gibberish. It's a lifestyle. A creed, if you will, in the grand odyssey of pretending you know exactly what you're doing. Spoiler: you don't. 

Consectetur laboratorium tempor sint? More like, 'let's see how much we can cram into one brain before it implodes!' Just remember, with each brain cell fatigued, you edge closer to knowing everything about nothing. Congratulations, that's genius! 

Feeling 'cupidatat ex'? Don't worry, it's not contagious—unless, of course, you opt into the premium package. Revel in your existential compliance and let irony be your guide as you navigate the labyrinth of 'is there really a point here?' Spoiler alert: there isn't! 

'Lorem ipsum dolor sit', they say; I say, let's embrace the nonsensical voyage while intermittently asking profound questions like, 'Why is there a 'di' in 'diis laborum'? Is it double cheese or an innocuous typo? 

Ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip'. But, let's face it, trying to decode that feels like Roman holiday in a washing machine. Ride the wave, enjoy the spin cycle, and let sundry musings guide you in this vehicular odyssey of random enlightenment. 

In summary, dear reader, may your quest to master the art of mastering nothing at all be as futile as it is glorious. Embrace the chaos, laugh heartily, and remember: Ex am Otticae ut sit amet, res exstatis, quandocumque et ubicumque—I'm sure that's a thing, right?"
}
```

```json
{
  "title": "Who Invited the Latin Guy? A Deep Dive into Nonsense",
  "content": "Ah, 'quis quis nostrud duis laborum in cupidatat ex qui consectetur laborum tempor sint.' For those fluent in gibberish, this is the Holy Grail. For everyone else, let's see how efficiently Google Translate throws in the towel. Once upon a caffeine-induced haze, someone decided to go all scandalous and string together random Latin words into sentences, because... Latin. 

“Consectetur laborum tempor sint.” Sounds like a rejected password to your ex’s Netflix account. But wait! This just in—scientists now say pretending to understand Latin boosts your IQ by zero, count 'em, zero points. 

Taking it one step further, I've distilled this sentence to its essence. Spoiler alert: There is none. It's as void as that junk drawer your mom refuses to clean. So here's the real scoop: Scrap the Latin, grab a donut, and just admit your not-so-secret love for Lo-fi hip-hop playlists during late-night existential crises. Truth is, Latin is to tech blogs what flip phones are to the metaverse—oddly irrelevant yet mysteriously enduring. Take that, Cicero.

Now go forth, my brave reader, and conquer the lands of future-forward blogging with some English, maybe a latte, and a sprinkle of sarcasm on top. Carpe whatever-you-want-carped!"
}
```
